content:
That's great to hear that you're prioritizing meal prep and exercise! Here are some healthy snack ideas that are quick, easy, and perfect for your weekday lunch breaks:

**Fresh Fruits and Veggies**

* Baby carrots with hummus
* Apple slices with almond butter
* Grapes and cheese
* Cut veggies (bell peppers, cucumbers, cherry tomatoes) with guacamole
* Fresh berries with Greek yogurt

**Nuts and Seeds**

* Trail mix with nuts and dried fruits
* Roasted chickpeas seasoned with herbs and spices
* Handful of almonds or cashews
* Sunflower seeds or pumpkin seeds

**Protein-packed Snacks**

* Hard-boiled eggs
* Greek yogurt with honey and nuts
* Cottage cheese with fruit
* Protein smoothie (prepare a batch on Sunday and store in individual cups)

**Whole Grain Crackers and Spreads**

* Whole grain crackers with peanut butter and banana slices
* Avocado toast on whole grain bread
* Whole grain crackers with hummus and veggies

**Energy Balls**

* No-bake energy balls made with oats, nuts, and dried fruits
* Protein energy balls with peanut butter and honey

**Other Ideas**

* Edamame
* Cut up veggies with ranch or tzatziki sauce
* Air-popped popcorn seasoned with herbs and spices
* Small serving of dark chocolate (at least 70% cocoa)

Remember, portion control is key when it comes to snacking. Aim for snacks that are around 100-200 calories each to keep you satisfied until your next meal.

Great job on fitting in exercise on the weekends! Consistency is key, and even a 30-minute walk or jog can make a big difference in your overall health and wellness.
